SEARCH
Package net.xpkgclient.packagemanager

Class ParseHelper

java.lang.Object
net.xpkgclient.packagemanager.ParseHelper
public final class ParseHelper extends Object
This class provide methods to easily help commands parse repeating scenarios (such as booleans and getting ...STRING's).

  • Method Details

    • isValidVarName

      public static boolean isValidVarName(String variable)
      Check if a variable name is valid.
      Parameters:
      variable - The variable name, including the dollar sign at the beginning, if the dollar sign is not present, it will be considered invalid.
      Returns:
      True if the variable name is valid. Does not guarantee existence.

    • isValidPath

      public static boolean isValidPath(@NotNull @NotNull String path)
      Check if a string can be considered a path. Also check for bad characters, like the tilde, percent sign, or double dots.
      Parameters:
      path - The potential path that is being checked. Requires a leading slash. If a leading slash is not present the path will be considered invalid.
      Returns:
      True if the path is valid.

    • isValidResourceId

      public static boolean isValidResourceId(String resourceId)
      Check if a resource id is valid, does not confirm if the resource exists.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - The id of the resource to check for validity.
      Returns:
      True if the resource id is valid.

    • isTrue

      public static boolean isTrue(String[] args, ExecutionContext context) throws XPkgParseException, XPkgUndefinedVarException, XPkgExecutionException, XPkgTypeMismatchException
      Evaluate a list of arguments and determine, based on the current execution context and constants if the expression evaluates to True.
      Parameters:
      args - The arguments to check.
      context - The execution context that this evaluation is running in.
      Returns:
      True if the expression evaluates to true with regard to the provided execution context.
      Throws:
      XPkgInvalidBoolStatement - Exception thrown if there is an unexpected token in the expression.
      XPkgUndefinedVarException - Exception thrown if a variable is undefined. Only thrown if the expression hasn't already been evaluated to true.
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Exception thrown if the execution context provided is closed.
      XPkgTypeMismatchException - Exception thrown if the type of a provided variable is not a boolean. Thrown even if the expression has already been evaluated to true.
      XPkgParseException
      XPkgExecutionException

    • getStr

      public static String getStr(String @NotNull [] args, ExecutionContext context) throws XPkgUndefinedVarException, XPkgInternalException, XPkgInvalidCallException
      Get remaining arguments as a string by determining if the first variable is a variable and returning that, or combining all values in args.
      Parameters:
      args - The arguments to get a string from.
      context - The execution context that this evaluation is running in.
      Returns:
      The string evaluation of the args.
      Throws:
      XPkgUndefinedVarException - Thrown if there is only one argument which is a valid variable name, but if the variable does not exist.
      XPkgInternalException - Thrown with the message 'arglen' if there are too many arguments (only happens if the first argument is a variable and there is more than one argument). Can also be thrown with the message 'mismatch' if the first argument exists and is a valid variable, but is not of type STRING. If thrown with 'mismatch' the type of the variable received will be thrown as a VarType enumeration as the exception's data.
      XPkgInvalidCallException - Thrown if the execution context provided is closed.

    • stringContains

      public static boolean stringContains(@NotNull @NotNull String testStr, @NotNull @NotNull String matches)
      Determine if a string matches any characters.
      Parameters:
      testStr - The string to test against.
      matches - The characters to check for in testStr.
      Returns:
      True if any characters in matches are inside testStr.
